intro: Senecio ogotorukensis, commonly known as the Ogotorukensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Namibia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
